835888944:
[

Project Manager

Company Name Duratec Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 78 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Role based in Melbourne CBD
  • Join one of Australia's fastest growing privately owned companies
  • Fast paced and rewarding role

\xa0

ABOUT US


Duratec Australia is a multi-disciplined builder and maintenance contractor and regarded as one of Australia's fastest growing privately owned companies with over 10 branches across Australia.


Our highly experienced Defence Division is dedicated to the delivery of capital facilities infrastructure and estate works program projects. \xa0Due to an increasing portfolio of awarded contracts, we are seeking an experienced Project Manager\xa0operating on site and at our offices near the Melbourne CBD.


ABOUT THE ROLE:


Reporting to the National Defence Manager, you will be primarily responsible for overall management of various Defence projects within the Melbourne Metro area as well as regional projects as required which includes the overall running of the projects including planning, coordination and controlling the projects to completion.


Due to the nature of this role regular site travel across the projects would be expected for to attend regular site inspections and client meetings. \xa0


Critical functions of the role include:


  • Controlling and managing all aspects of the project
  • Project managing from initial site setup to completion
  • Ensuring compliance with HSECQ requirements
  • Ensuring effective cost control and efficient running of the project
  • Coordinating direct labour and subcontractors
  • Project progress reporting and conducting weekly meetings
  • Provision of advice on any technical and engineering issues
  • Liaise closely with the client ensuring project runs to program


ABOUT YOU:


To be successful in this role you will have:


  • Minimum of 8 years' project management experience, including extensive exposure to the Australian market
  • Degree qualified in Engineering or Construction Management
  • Broad and detailed knowledge of project management skills and methodologies
  • Experience in managing and forecasting budgets
  • Proven and demonstrated experience overseeing large projects and resources or multiple teams delivering smaller projects
  • Previous experience managing a portfolio of smaller projects and site based resources
  • Ability to effectively lead project teams and direct and motivate colleagues and contractors
  • Australian Citizen with the ability to gain Defence Baseline clearance
  • Self-driven professional with a collaborative approach to achieving results
  • Team player with solid negotiation and influencing skills
  • Excellent communication skills and a proven ability to develop employees and build strong successful teams
  • The ability to manage conflict and remain calm in a high-pressure environment
  • Applicants residing in other States, who are willing to relocate are encouraged to apply


WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU


This is a rare and exciting opportunity for an experienced and dedicated professional to make their mark whilst working for a positive and cohesive organisation with a strong reputation. If you are looking for a challenging position with genuine development and progression opportunities then we want to hear from you.


An attractive remuneration package is on offer, negotiable with skills and experience including a company vehicle. This role is also available for relocation within Australia for suitable candidates.


You would be joining an existing successful and growing business where the foundations for growth and support required to build have already been established.


The role is supported by an established project base along with a strong pipeline of new works.

This is an exciting opportunity to play a critical role in the ongoing development of business strategy and growth of the Division.


HOW TO APPLY


If you are ready to take the next step in your career and are passionate about joining a fast and growing company then we want to hear from you. To apply please click on Apply and complete the online application form.


Duratec Australia is committed to building a workplace culture that values diversity and inclusion. We actively promote the employment of people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, LGBTI and other diversity groups.


**NO AGENCY CONTACT AT THIS TIME**

835873301:
[

Non Executive Director

Company Name Herba Healthcare PTY LTD Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 82 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

More and more research is showing just how powerful cannabis can be in treating severe illnesses and managing pain and side effects. The endocannabinoid system and the cannabis plant, with its many different cannabinoids, is the raw material for the medicine of our future. While this trend has been sweeping the globe, Australia has been lagging behind, until now.

\xa0

Enter Herba Health Care Australia Pty Ltd (Herba), a private Company based in Melbourne that was founded to develop and market phytopharmaceutical cannabis products, based on full plant extracts from our extensive range of proprietary genetics.

\xa0

Herba’s goal is to be one of the leading pharmaceutical cannabis companies in Australia with co-developments to register medicine for sale worldwide. The first drugs to be registered will be for the treatment of Epilepsy and Neuropathic Pain.

\xa0

There is little doubt that cannabis-based drugs for medicinal use will have a significant market share in future medication. It still has to be determined for which applications of use it will be able to best assist with unmet medical needs, and therefore open new markets and for which it may partially replace existing solutions by being more cost-effective or/and have less unwanted side effects.

\xa0

The worldwide cannabis market – recreational and medicinal - is expected to reach USD 140 billion by 2020 according to current industry reports2. Cannabis is now legal or decriminalized in 44 countries worldwide, with more countries expected to follow. Medicinal cannabis has the potential to replace up to 20% of the world’s medicinal market.

Herba is searching for Directors who can make a measurable impact, and want skin in the game while working with the founders to rapidly grow the company.

The successful candidates will have skill and experience in the following areas:

\xa0

  • Leadership experience in multiple global markets
  • Experience managing a global pharmaceuticals firm
  • A personal track record of investing in and leading growing companies to successful exit
  • Financial management, governance and/or legal skills with an ASX listed company
  • Building strategic, high-level partnerships in the pharma industry
  • High-level experience in the development and delivery of pharmaceuticals & clinical trials
  • Trade sale or ASX listing experience in pharma or medical industries

\xa0

The company is keen to make an appointment by the end of September 2018.

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Senior Test Engineer - Melbourne

Company Name Global Kinetics Corporation Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 163 views

Job description

Global Kinetics is currently seeking an experienced Senior Test Engineer to work in our Melbourne office. \xa0Our work environment is fast-paced, with a collaborative atmosphere. Most of all, we are passionate about delivery innovations that transform the quality of health care and the patient experience. We are looking for like-minded individuals to join our team today. \xa0

This newly created position will have responsibility for leading all testing strategies, covering all areas of the testing lifecycle in multiple domains, primarily for our software product but also hardware.


\xa0Key responsibilities:


\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Quality Engineer and Software Tester

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Provide excellence in quality engineering practices;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Support the developers to create frameworks that support automated testing;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Support the Senior System Analyst to define test criteria for new features;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Create test cases and execute testing;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Measure the level of automation and test coverage and support the goal of continuous improvement;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Report effectiveness and propose continuous improvements;

This role has a lot of potential to develop and implement new test strategies and tools to support an ambitious and growing organisation, as such comes with significant responsibility for the right candidate.

\xa0 \xa0

Skills/Qualifications:

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 B. Sc in Engineering discipline (Computer of Electronic preferred)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Minimum 5+ years demonstrable experience in senior testing roles

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Advanced skills and experience in automating testing for a software platform, both backend and frontend; as well as experience and know-how at building out automated deployment pipelines that support ongoing automated testing.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience using up to date software development and quality practices, including test driven development, automated testing, continuous integration and continuous delivery.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Certified ISTQB at Foundation and/or Advanced Test Analyst level

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Certified in Certified Agile Essentials or Certified Agile Testing courses.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Self-starter, creative thinker, proactive and enthusiastic; and a team player, as keen on the success of those around you as of your own.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Great communicator and have proven experience in collaborating effectively with business stakeholders.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Exceptional attention to detail and time management skills.

Interested? \xa0We’d love to hear from you!

\xa0

Please send your CV and a covering letter addressing how you meet the key responsibilities of the role to: recruitment@globalkineticscorp.com

\xa0

Applicants must be Australian or NZ citizens/permanent residents or hold full working rights to be considered.

\xa0
